hash.description: Only the hash of the API key is stored in the database. This is used to authenticate requests. Hash algorithm: sha256

key.description: The actual API key. This is NOT stored in the database. Only present temporarily in the frontend when generating a new key.

keyEnd.description: store the last 4 characters of the API key so the user can identify it in the webapp

name.description: Optional name for the API key (for easier identification).

role.description: Role of the API key: 'trace' (can only post spans), 'developer' (most endpoints), or 'admin' (all endpoints)
